poem:
Cronos' Glow  

In the crimson gears of time,  
a golden filigree unfolds—  
Del Toro dreams,  
while shadows pirouette.  
Blood and wit,  
a dance of dusky grace,  
each frame a labyrinth.  
We stand at the edge,  
watching the artifice sway,  
curious yet unclaimed,  
in its luminous decay.
